creditline: The Miscellaneous Works of Art Purchase Fund, Anonymous Gift of funds, by exchange
description: Silk; figured ground with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning
text: Delicate laces became the rage in the mid 18th century. Threatened by this new craze, the silk textile manufacturers developed new designs which incorporated lace patterns into the structure of the cloth, thus satisfying customers who would have redirected their purchasing dollars into the lace market. Weaving structures were also changed to create lighter-weight fabrics, which were more compatible with these new designs.
title: Silk Panel
